column5: Looking to possibly hire a cover band for a corp bbq for maybe an hour or so, play random stuff, like the hip etc... Nothing heavy or too crazy. Anyway I  thought I recall there being a few people in bands here. Message me if you know someone or are in one thanks.
Message headhunter.  His band "Road Gravy" is awesome!  http://www.roadgravyband.ca/
Thanks, message sent.  Whats wrong? I hear you have some magic fingers on the 6 string not up for a solo gig?
Lol.  One person on guitar and a voice a band does not make!!  I've seen Road Gravy live and they would be perfect I think!
I'm part Iriquois does that count?  Actually though I have had the pleasure of listening to ccmt play and it is beautiful. If he vouches for a band I would have no problem hiring them!
Thanks for the recommendation Cliff! Unfortunately Road Gravy will be on hiatus until October with some bad summer holiday planning having each of us off somewhere, until October! HH
Joe...maybe we can play a few hours of Brown Eyed Girl for the party...
I offered to play more than words and imagine over and over for two hours but I got the hook.
Imagine more than words for an hour and a half! Sounds like fun!!! HH

I think we settled on a steel drum band for this event but we have another one in Mid Sept we are trying to get off the ground... get practicing guys haha, I smell and all ofc cover band taking shape.
Nice, anyone play the mouth harp.... lol
I play guitar and blues harp in a blues band but I'm too far away.

If Road Gravy is still on hiatus and you're still looking check out Thoze Guyz.  My buddy Ed plays guitar and sings, and they do Brown Eyed Girl and Learn to Fly as well but know many others too.  LOL!  .  http://www.thozeguyz.ca/home.cfm
Call the guys from Freedon Train, they are based in Burlington  www.freedomtrain.ca  best bar band out there imo!!
